page.title: 11A POEM ABOUT TOURISM
page.content:
The children were invited to write a poem about tourism.Here is what one boy wrote:
The people who come here Are normaly friendly They drive on the road Oh so bendy Its nice to help them Find their way around But they might be in an aeroplane Above the ground They're in the town They're in the street They're in the butchers Buying meat. They drive you really barmy It's like a massive army The summer's gone They have gone away I think I'll miss them At least another day. {Ben Peters
